TopicTitle: It's raining cats and dogs where I'm at.

Articles.Content:
So apparently there\'s a huge thunderstorm here in Colorado and there\'s thunder, lightning, wind, and rain. It\'s super loud, bright, and I can\'t sleep. Help :c

Also

Please don\'t tell me a tornado is worse. I\'ve been in one back in Texas, and, while we had to use candles and flashlights, it was nowhere near as bad as this.
A hurricane is worse.
Be careful.

A hurricane is worse.

This is true.

Seems to have stopped for the time being.
It never rains here in Wyoming. Made it feel like the Northwest tonight!

Tornadoes are, surprisingly, more common in Britain than in Ammerica.

America just gets bigger ones.
Think of a rocket spinning around above your head but Jebediah still as full control 8)

It\'s warm and sunny up here in the North, eh? ;P

Yeah, it\'s gettin\' crazy here. 40 degrees Celsius (About 110F) last summer and we got a 20 (80F) in March, when it\'s usually about the inverse, -20 (Uhh.. Really, really cold F)

It\'s warm and sunny up here in the North, eh? ;P

Yeah, it\'s gettin\' crazy here. 40 degrees Celsius (About 110F) last summer and we got a 20 (80F) in March, when it\'s usually about the inverse, -20 (Uhh.. Really, really cold F)

Where do you live that uses metric!?

*lub*

Now if only the rest of my country would convert to the clearly superior measurement system...

Where do you live that uses metric!?

*lub*

Now if only the rest of my country would convert to the clearly superior measurement system...

Lol. You and Burma, my friend. You and Burma..

Lol. You and Burma, my friend. You and Burma..

Go hug those tigers!

Go hug those tigers!

\'Cause we all know that will end up well.

\'Cause we all know that will end up well.

You just have to give them a tickle.
holy s### man, i live in denver. Did you hear about the mini tornado at 38th and tower road. That scared the crap out of me.
Ive never been in a tornado but my house has been struck by lightning 2 or three times. On the bright side some idiots built a GIANT house next to us
I slept through an earthquake.

I slept through an earthquake.

How the heck do you sleep through an earthquake?!

I have had an earthquake, it spread from somewhere in Virginia all the way to Boston.

Luckily it was a very low class one...

I have slept through a mini one, this one was an aftershock of the mini one.(This one was bigger than the mini one was though.)

Well, good luck. Down here in Texas we aren\'t having cats and dogs falling upon us, but it is much wetter than last year. I haven\'t been in a tornado, nor a hurricane, though I have been in the very outer storms of a hurricane that can get quite splashy and flood-like.
No tsunamis or hurricanes here at lake constance ;P Just lightning strikes and very rare mini earthquakes.

Well, good luck. Down here in Texas we aren\'t having cats and dogs falling upon us, but it is much wetter than last year. I haven\'t been in a tornado, nor a hurricane, though I have been in the very outer storms of a hurricane that can get quite splashy and flood-like.

I\'ve been on the edge of a hurricane to.

Just last August when hurricane Irene passed by NJ we got hit with massive rain.

No tsunamis or hurricanes here at lake constance ;P Just lightning strikes and very rare mini earthquakes.

The earthquake that hit me was VERY VERY rare.

The only reason half the east coast was effected was because our plates were so still.

How the heck do you sleep through an earthquake?!

I have had an earthquake, it spread from somewhere in Virginia all the way to Boston.

Luckily it was a very low class one...

I have slept through a mini one, this one was an aftershock of the mini one.(This one was bigger than the mini one was though.)

Market Rasen earthquake 2008.

The 2008 Lincolnshire earthquake struck Lincolnshire, in the United Kingdom, on 27 February 2008 at 00:56:47.8s GMT. According to the British Geological Survey, the quake registered a reading of 5.2 on the Richter scale with the epicentre 2.5 miles (4 km) north of Market Rasen and 15 miles (24 km) south-west of Grimsby near to Claxby on the Lincolnshire Wolds.[1]

My Dad\'s armchair bounced.
Jesus :\'(, its raining again!!! for the third time in two days

Ive never been in a tornado but my house has been struck by lightning 2 or three times. On the bright side some idiots built a GIANT house next to us

Bro, put a lightning rod on top of your roof. Stops the lightning

Market Rasen earthquake 2008.

My Dad\'s armchair bounced.

My mom serousily thought the shaking was from the washing machine being overloaded...

Then we found out that my sisters friend felt it.(She lives like 2 miles away...)

I ran under my desk and ducked.

My mom serousily thought the shaking was from the washing machine being overloaded...

Then we found out that my sisters friend felt it.(She lives like 2 miles away...)

I ran under my desk and ducked.

I think my Dad was in his armchair at the time.
